resources.string:
Dear Developer,
Welcome to Naroid - Sample Android App.

This project is open source! Full source code is available at https://github.com/phpdevmd/NaroidSampleAndroidApp.

You are free to re-use and re-distribute it.

Developed by phpdevmd@gmail.com.

The main idea here is to make your layout xml like this:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<ScrollView xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
	android:layout_width="fill_parent"
	android:layout_height="wrap_content">
	<LinearLayout
		android:orientation="vertical"
		android:layout_width="fill_parent"
		android:layout_height="wrap_content">
		<TextView
			android:layout_width="fill_parent"
			android:layout_height="wrap_content"
			android:text="@string/lorem_ipsum_1_line"/>
	</LinearLayout>
</ScrollView>

Expected more work here? Sorry to disappoint :)

Localization is just about creating an alternative set of resources in res folder, and android will automatically substitute it in the appropriate device.

For example, to translate your application into another language, create /res/values-(ISO 639-1 language code)/strings.xml file with translated strings (e.g. values-ru, values-en-rGB and so on). Please make sure to include a default resource (e.g. /res/values/strings.xml).

See http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/resources/localization.html for more information.
